passages.text:
Industrial & Commercial Bank of
China (1398.HK)
Inline 2Q25 w/ record high trading gain the key positive

ICBC reported resilient 1H25 PPOP growth of +1.3% y-y to RMB300.5bn and 1H25 NPAT decline of -1.4% y-y to Rmb168.1bn, which is broadly in line with our preview expectation, (forming 47% of FY25 consensus estimate). 2Q25 PPOP jumped +7.4% y-y in 2Q25 (a notable turnaround vs. -3.9% y-y in 1Q25), mainly thanks to strong trading gain (possibly relating to FX gain from the bank's Argentina branch). 2Q25 NPAT came in slower, +1.4% y-y (albeit still an acceleration vs. -4% y-y in 1Q25), due to provision increase (+12.9% y-y in 2Q25). ROA/ROE were down -5bp/-48bp y-y to 0.65%/9.0% in 2Q25. ICBC declared an interim DPS of RMB0.1414/shr for 1H25 (-1.4% y-y), implying a payout ratio of 30% (unchanged y-y).

**Key Positives**—Loan growth was resilient +1.5% q-q/+8.4% y-y in 2Q25 (vs +4.8% q-q/+9.0% y-y in 1Q25), mainly driven by growth in corporate loans (+1.3% q-q in 2Q), while retail loan growth remained muted (+0.3% q-q only in 2Q); As resilient loan growth (+1.5% q-q) outpaced steady deposits growth (+1.3% q-q in 2Q25), LDR was brought up by +0.19ppt q-q to 81.8% in 2Q25; Trading gain was a bright spot, +106% q-q/+51.8% y-y in 2Q25, to reach RMB17.44bn, which is an all-time high, forming c.8.5% of total revenue in 2Q25 (+4.4ppt q-q/+2.5ppt y-y), likely thanks to both favorable bond market condition and FX gain from ICBC's Argentina branch; CIR was reduced by -0.53ppt y-y to 29.0% in 2Q25 mainly thanks to revenue strength (+6.5% y-y in 2Q25) helping offset the drag from OPEX increase (+4.6% y-y in 2Q). While CET-1 CAR was flattish q-q to reach 13.89% in 2Q25, tier-1/total CAR were up +14bp/+39bp q-q to 15.25%/19.54% in 2Q25, likely thanks to tier2 bond/ perpetual bond issuance of RMB50bn /RMB40bn in Apr/May-2025 respectively, which have helped boosted tier1/total CAR by 19bp/34bp respectively based on 2Q25 RWA. (Continue on P.2)
BuyPrice (29 Aug 25 16:10)HK$5.77Target priceHK$7.42Expected share price28.6%returnExpected dividend yield6.1%Expected total return34.7%Market CapHK$2,056,464MUS$263,862M
Source: Powered by dataCentral
See Appendix A-1 for Analyst Certification, Important Disclosures and Research Analyst Affiliations.

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Key Negatives—NIM compressed by \(- 6bp q - q\) to \(1.27\%\) in 2Q25, likely on lower asset yield, down \(- 17bp q - q\) by our est. likely due to unfavorable loan mix shift towards low yielding discount bills, which formed \(48\%\) of new loan allocation in 2Q, \(+46\) ppt q- q amid weak credit demand environment; Meanwhile funding cost provided limited offset, \(- 8bp q - q\) per our estimate, possibly thanks to prior deposit rate cut bearing fruit. Fee income remains muted, \(+0.3\%\) y- y in 2Q25 (vs. \(- 1.2\%\) y- y in 1Q25), likely dragged by weak settlement/guarantee fee income (which fell - \(11.3\% / - 21.6\%\) y- y in 1H25); Asset quality was mixed. NPL ratio was stable at \(1.33\%\) (flat q- q in 2Q25), thanks to lower corporate NPL ratio (- 13bp h- h to \(1.38\%\) in 1H25, w/ broad- based corporate NPL ratio decline h- h observed in 1H25 across all sectors except for property sector), helping offset the increase in retail NPL ratio by \(+20bp h - h\) to \(1.35\%\) in 1H25 (due to higher NPL ratio across personal biz loans /credit card/ mortgage /consumption loan book, by \(+35bp / + 25bp / + 13bp / + 12bp\) h- h to \(1.62\% /3.75\% /0.86\% /3.75\%\) in 1H25). However, after adding back write offs, NPL formation rate picked up \(+11bp y - y\) to \(0.43\%\) in 2Q25. Meanwhile, both overdue loan ratio /overdue \(>3\) mth loan ratio picked up by \(+9bp / + 7bp h - h\) to \(1.52\% /1.07\%\) in 1H25. NPL to overdue \(>3\) month loan ratio fell - 10ppt h- h to \(123\%\) in 1H25, indicating that ICBC had likely relaxed NPL recognition standard in 1H25. Of comfort, against mixed asset quality trend, ICBC charged a conservative credit cost of \(63bp (+2bp y - y)\) , which allowed NPL coverage ratio to edge up slightly to \(217.7\%\) in 2Q25 (+2ppt q- q). Effective tax was \(+3.3\) ppt y- y to \(15.4\%\) in 2Q25.

Implications—Despite surging 2Q25 PPP growth of \(+7.4\%\) y- y (ranked third highest among Big- 6 banks), ICBC took the opportunity of PPP strength and have further stepped- up provision to build NPL coverage (+2ppt q- q to \(217.7\%\) ) in 2Q25. While this resulted in a mediocre 2Q25 NPAT growth of \(+1.4\%\) y- y (ranking slightly below Big6 banks, e.g. PSBC/ABC/BOCOM/CCB delivered NPAT growth of \(+4.8\% / + 3.2\% /1.7\% /1.6\%\) y- y in 2Q), we do not hold it against the bank as we see pre- emptive provisioning could help better ICBC for potential NPL formation increase in 2H25E, and create more room for provision release in 2H25 to help the bank still deliver at least a flattish earnings growth for full year 2025E (vs. ICBC's 1H25 earnings was down \(- 1.4\%\) y- y, ranking below Big6 banks' avg in 1H). Worth noting, as ICBC is in the second batch of large banks recapitalization likely in 2026, this implies no equity dilution risk in 2025E. Against this backdrop, we flag that ICBC- A/- H 25E dividend yield of \(4.2\% /5.8\%\) looks attractive, ranking the 2nd highest/highest among A-/H- shr Big6 banks. Also, even factoring in potential equity dilution from recapitalization in 2026 (c.4.6% on our estimate), ICBC- A/- H 26E dividend yield of \(4.0\% /5.5\%\) still remain decent in our view.
Figure 1.ICBC 2Q25 result at a glance

Industrial & Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) is the largest commercial bank in China in terms of assets, loans and deposits. Headquartered in Beijing, ICBC provides diversified banking services to over 4 million corporate clients and 300 million individual customers through more than 17,000 branches in China. In addition, the bank also operates over 500 overseas branches and offices in major financial centers across the globe.

We rate the ICBC H- shares as Buy. We believe ICBC's strong balance sheet, above- peer profitability (the highest ROA among our coverage supported by low funding cost) and diversified business mix will make it more resilient in the current challenging macro environment. We believe ICBC's strong capital base marks its more defensive position, and allows it to maintain stable balance sheet growth, absorb potential credit cost hike and maintain a stable dividend payout ratio.

We use an Economic Value Added (EVA) model to determine our target price of HK\$7.42 for ICBC H- shares. EVA is commonly used to value banks, especially when rate liberalization has kicked off and ROE is likely to drop. Our assumptions include a sustainable ROE of \(9\%\) and long- term growth of \(3\%\) . We adopt a cost of equity of \(14.4\%\) , which suggests a fair 2026E P/B of 0.56x.

Key downside risks that could mean the ICBC H- shares fail to achieve our EVA- based target price include: 1) rising competition that undermines ICBC's market- leading position; 2) a negative impact from bank dis- intermediation; and 3) weaker than expected macro- economic trends.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

Card Insights. Where this report references Card Insights data, Card Insights consists of selected data from a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions. Such data has undergone rigorous security protocols to keep all customer information confidential and secure; the data is highly aggregated and anonymized so that all unique customer identifiable information is removed from the data prior to receipt by the report's author or distribution to external parties. This data should be considered in the context of other economic indicators and publicly available information. Further, the selected data represents only a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions due to the selection methodology or other limitations and should not be considered as indicative or predictive of the past or future financial performance of Citi or its credit card business.
